name: LLM Council
description: Multi-model consensus engine that summons OpenAI Codex, Google Gemini, and Claude to collaboratively answer your technical questions through peer review and synthesis.
longDescription:
The LLM Council plugin transforms Claude Code into a multi-model deliberation system. When you have a complex technical question, instead of getting one perspective, you get three AI models working together:

1. **Opinion Collection**: Your question is sent to Claude, OpenAI Codex, and Google Gemini in parallel
2. **Peer Review**: Each model anonymously reviews the others' responses, identifying strengths and weaknesses
3. **Chairman Synthesis**: Claude Opus synthesizes all inputs into a final verdict with consensus points and areas of disagreement

Perfect for architecture decisions, code reviews, debugging complex issues, and any question where multiple perspectives add value.

commands.name: /council
commands.description: Summon the LLM Council for multi-model deliberation

agents.name: council-chairman
agents.description: Synthesizes council outputs into a final verdict

screenshots.caption: LLM Council deliberating on a technical question

examples.title: Architecture Decision
examples.command: /council "Should I use microservices or a monolith for my new SaaS product?"

examples.title: Code Review
examples.command: /council "Review this authentication implementation for security issues"

examples.title: Performance Optimization
examples.command: /council "How can I optimize React component re-renders in my dashboard?"
